intro: Sphaeranthus volgensis, commonly known as the goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Sphaeranthus volgensis is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
